definition: to restore sth to its original state
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out

sentences.english: When pressure is lost, the air pressure inside the cell meeting general cell is restorable .
sentences.chinese: 當壓力失去時，細胞內的空氣壓力會將細胞恢復原狀。

sentences.english: To handle an invalid contract must abide by the principle of restitution .
sentences.chinese: 處理無效合同應當遵循恢復原狀的原則。

sentences.english: After a given length of time the buoy sinks itself and is not recovered.
sentences.chinese: 浮標自身下沉，並且不再恢復原狀。

sentences.english: Hand clenched face loosen, crease is not obvious, and can be quickly restored.
sentences.chinese: 用手捏緊呢面鬆開，摺痕不明顯，且能迅速恢復原狀。

sentences.english: As the world economy stabilizes, the older relationships should largely return.
sentences.chinese: 隨着世界經濟趨穩，傳統的關係將基本恢復原狀。

sentences.english: I worked hard to restore the wall and the floor to its former condition.
sentences.chinese: 又費了很大的力把牆壁及地板恢復原狀。

sentences.english: Need to be returned to Yang state, the whole natures will resume elemental shape.
sentences.chinese: 待回了揚州，一切自然會恢復原狀的。

sentences.english: Comb clear and coherent, natural air, after air can restorable .
sentences.chinese: 梳理通順，自然晾乾，晾乾後即可恢復原狀。

sentences.english: When I think about the bamboo tree's ability to bounce back or return to its original position.
sentences.chinese: 每當我想到竹子這種彈回去或者說恢復原狀的本領時。

sentences.english: After pressing can very fast restorable, general quality is better.
sentences.chinese: 壓後能夠很快恢復原狀的，一般質量較好。

sentences.english: From such a position, "you just can't recover.
sentences.chinese: 在這樣的姿態下，“你根本無法恢復原狀。

sentences.english: Stop using the tiny keyboard on your PDA and see if they grow back to normal.
sentences.chinese: 停止使用你的掌上電腦，看看它們能不能恢復原狀。

definition: (jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to dismiss with severance pay/to pay sb off
